attributes.action: Scrap driving theory test
attributes.background: The theory test is a waste of time, effort and most importantly money. I think it should be removed for good.

attributes.action: Refuse to take part in war in Syria and find a diplomatic path to peace
attributes.background: Bombing Syria will not help the situation. It will kill more civilians and ignite a conflict that could spiral out of control, causing massive devastation. We call on the government to refuse to engage in the conflict. Focus on political solutions and aiding diplomacy between the US and Russia
attributes.additional_details: A conflict in Syria between U.S. and Russian forces is not only something that we cannot afford to take part in, it's something we should do everything in our power to prevent. The potential consequences of such a conflict - a huge civilian death toll and the risk of igniting nuclear war - are things that need to be avoided at all costs. We urge the government not to take part in any military action in Syria but instead, with urgency, focus all available resources on finding political solutions and aiding diplomatic relations between the U.S. and Russian governments.

attributes.action: Subsidy on "free from" products for people with food allergies
attributes.background: After having a child who is food intolerant to several things including dairy, wheat and fish & meeting several people in similar positions who all struggle to get anything on prescription, I want to petition for the Government to provide a subsidy for these expensive but necessary items.

attributes.action: Create regulatory body to set the standards and ethics of AI development.
attributes.background: Working under the acronym OF-AIR - Office of AI Regulation, this organisation would utilise respected minds across areas such as Ethical Philosophy, Law and Technology to regulate the means and use of AI across technological sectors to prevent industrial monopoly or unethical development.
attributes.additional_details: From self driving cars or platooning vehicles, to corrupt algorithms manipulating politics and ultimately the ability to create robots that can 'think for themselves', what was once the realms of Science Fiction is now upon us as a reality and should be controlled to prevent corruption across both industry and individuals and to mitigate political and unlawful gain.

attributes.action: Change the A1 license - Motorcycle
attributes.background: My suggested change is if you are 18+ Years old and obtain an A1 license you can ride a motorcycle up to a 300cc with no power greater than 23 kw (30 bhp) Restrictions can be placed on the bike. This will give people an incentive to obtain this license. Making more people do motorcycle training.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently you can obtain an A1 license at 17+ Years old Which allows you to ride a motorcycle up to a 125cc with no more power of 11kw (15 bhp) you no longer display L plates, you can carry a pillion and have access to the motorway. 

Cbt allows you to ride a motorcycle up to a 125cc with no more power of 11kw (15 bhp) as long as you display L plates front and back, don’t Carry pillions and don’t go onto the motorway.

17 year olds have no restriction on what car they can drive after passing.

attributes.action: Start supplementing milk with Vitamin D.
attributes.background: Many countries supplement their milk supply with vitamin d and the UK which rarely gets sunshine does not.
attributes.additional_details: There has been evidence showing that many in the UK suffer from vitamin d deficiencies.

attributes.action: Stop roll out of "Academies" to SEN schools.
attributes.background: Stop rolling out academy schools to SEN Schools. How can a private company do better? It's all about money. How can a shared head teacher have lead in the school? The situation is wrong. The government want to pass schools on, reduce budgets and then blame someone else for the schools doing bad.

attributes.action: Mandatory weekly hour classes in current politics in secondary schools.
attributes.background: Give secondary school children a chance to learn about the different parties in the UK and their policies (etc) from an unbiased perspective. Learn about current affairs both locally and abroad, voting etc. Give everyone the right to unbiased knowledge to make well informed decisions as adults.
attributes.additional_details: I propose hour classes once a week in order to keep children engaged and updated. Teach the requirements for voting, the process of voting, current party policies for each party, practice voting etc. Engage in current debates and learn of foreign affairs that affect both the UK and the world. Allow them the advantage of awareness when coming to the voting age for both fair and thoroughly considered decisions. Studying Holocaust Literature in my degree has inspired me to propose this.

attributes.action: Working people should be awarded 100% of the non working partners tax allowance
attributes.background: Every UK citizen is intitled to tax free income of 11500 pa. The fact that in a family unit only one person may be in full time employment while the other person may be at home bringing up children is not a good reason to financially penalise that family or any other in a similar position.

attributes.action: Bring back nit nurse to UK schools send them home till treated and clear 2018
attributes.background:
Sick of nits £££ on products such as treatments and repellents.
Hours spent combing through hair.
Laundry through constant washing.
Kids crying you pulling and tugging to the point you want to shave their head.
attributes.additional_details:
Abroad they still have nit nurses that come to check children’s heads in school regularly, once head lice are found the child is sent home and not allowed to return till rechecked and cleared.
I lived abroad and this works 100%.
Eliminates before it can even start to spread.
Desperate mum of a girl with beautiful long hair that seriously can’t take this anymore.

attributes.action: Conduct rolling referenda so that the Brexit deal commands support AT THE TIME
attributes.background: Older voters, who were more likely to have died by the time 'Leave' takes effect, tended to favour 'Leave', whilst those under the age of 18, who will live much longer with the consequences, didn't get a vote at all.
attributes.additional_details:
The proposal is to conduct a potentially rolling sequence of referenda to ensure that the final outcome from the Brexit negotiations reflects the widest possible support AT THE TIME THE FINAL DEAL COMES INTO EFFECT.

There are 4 options. 1. Take the deal. 2. Re-negotiate 3. Stay in the EU 4. Leave with no agreement.

The voters rank the options in order of preference.

When one option commands more than 50 percent of the votes, or if the top option is 2, re-negotiate, that's what HMG will action.

Otherwise the option with the fewest votes is eliminated, and its supporters' votes are re-allocated to their next preferences.

If option 2, re-negotiate, wins, there would have to be a further referendum 3 months later, conducted as above.

attributes.action: Increase the driving age to 21
attributes.background: I believe that being able to drive at 17 is far too young and the age limit should be increased to 21 to try and save lives

attributes.action: Raise awareness of endometriosis, for all women 18 to 60 +
attributes.background: Raise awareness of endometriosis, for all women 18 to 60 +,men if they know women who are effected. for delivery within professional and public services such as doctors, women's health clinics, to raise awareness of issues faced, treatment by doctors and early detection.
attributes.additional_details: is is important to gain a better understanding of the long term costs and implications to health of those who are effected, awareness of the amount of women affected, hereditary implications and risks associated such as forced hysterectomies, major surgeries and the long term implications to finances and employment of those concerned due to pain and discomfort of symptoms.

attributes.action: Require Schools in England to teach & sing the National Anthem once a week
attributes.background: Only 35% of the UK are proud to be British says a recent poll, this is a giant drop from 10 years ago! Why? The UK with England at it's heart invented the most popular sports. Have legends in Music, Arts, Science, Finance.. Team GB came 2nd at the Olympics!! So let's help regrow the National pride!!
attributes.additional_details: The USA, France and many countries sing their Anthem weekly in schools. Why do we not? We have so much to be proud of. From Yorkshire Puddings to Julie Dench, Mo Farah to Harry Potter. Whether it's Music, Arts, Sports, Commerce or any other possible area England are up there and dominating. Patriotism is falling rapidly, we need to help regrow the passion and allow our children to be taught the Anthem in Schools and to be proud like they should be of the great Country which they are living in.

attributes.action: Make Recycling Compulsory
attributes.background: The united kingdom is falling behind on the amount of recycling compared to other European countries. We could fix this by making recycling compulsory, a tax reduction (similar to charity donations) and education for younger generations that will encourage new generations to recycle more often.
attributes.additional_details: The United Kingdom is falling behind on recycling rates compared to other developed nations such as France and Germany causing 60% of waste going to landfill. This needs to change. I propose that we can end this through making recycling compulsory, through methods such as: an increase tax for if landfill waste increases, a tax reduction for companies that increase the percentage recycled, similar to charity donations and encouraging new generations to recycle through education within schools.

attributes.action: Examine viable options for nationalising Thames Water.
attributes.background: In March 2018 up to 20,000 London households suffered an unplanned interruption in their water supply.  This lasted several days and caused significant hardship and distress. It was likely due to vital infrastructure being unable to cope with adverse weather conditions due to underinvestment.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/jan/09/nationalise-rail-gas-water-privately-owned

https://www.theguardian.com/business/nils-pratley-on-finance/2017/nov/24/thames-water-explains-why-nationalisation-is-suddenly-popular

https://www.telegraph.co.uk/business/2017/07/01/thames-water-bows-ofwat-pressure-chairman-heads-exit/

https://www.ofwat.gov.uk/ofwat-statement-thames-water-leakage-commitments/

https://www.theguardian.com/business/2017/nov/30/thames-water-ofwat-performance

attributes.action: Give Police more resources to tackle online grooming and the budget required
attributes.background:
We have many paedophile hunting groups trying to tackle this problem 
Protecting our children should be priority number one
attributes.additional_details:
Currently over 100 hunting groups in the UK because the Police don't have the resources
Give Police more resources to tackle online grooming and the budget required
We have Parents taking to the streets in a bid to expose online predators because our current system does not scratch the surface

attributes.action: Require schools to start at 9:30 and end at 3:30.
attributes.background: Children find it extremely difficult to wake up at 7:30 and get to school by 8 or 8:30. Most children hate coming to school because of the time you have to wake up. An extra hour of sleep helps retain information and helps the child perform better at school.
attributes.additional_details: Starting school at 9:30 and ending it at 3:30 gives us 6 hours of education where students are actually awake in lessons because they have had enough time to sleep.

attributes.action: I want to start a petition to ban fixed odds betting machines in all book makers
attributes.background: I want to ban all fixed odd gaming machine in all bookmakers. I think these machines exploit people and the human brain, these bookmakers spend thousands of pounds in doing this. People have ruined thier own lives and people around them lives by playing these highly addictive machines.

attributes.action: Stop Penalty Charges for Driving in Bus Lanes on Bank Holidays
attributes.background: Bus time on bank holiday is same Sunday. Many local councils make money using bus lane on bank holiday. Their actions is not benefit to our society.

attributes.action: Increase the capacity of prisons by building 5 new prisons by 2022.
attributes.background: Throughout the UK over the last few years the increase of crime has put pressure onto prisons and the justice system. Therefore because there aren't enough spaces in prisons, criminals may get away with crimes they have committed. If more prisons are built, it will create more space for criminals.

attributes.action: Make the Care Certificate a mandatory minimum qualification for all care staff
attributes.background:
The Care Certificate course, an outcome of the Cavendish review back in 2013, has still not been made mandatory training for care workers.

In fact, there is still no mandatory minimum level of training for care workers and no quality assurance for training in the care industry.
attributes.additional_details:
In the childcare industry, a nursery must ensure 50% of their workforce are trained to a minimum of Level 2 NVQ for the protection of the children in their care. Aside from DBS checks, many carers are providing care to elderly people in their homes where they live alone, and are doing so without a minimum level of skill.

As we face the realities of an aging population in the UK, what price do we put on providing the best possible care for our elderly relatives, friends, and relatives?

attributes.action: Make PIP awards subject to a letter from a persons medical team only.
attributes.background: PIP awards are currently subject to an assessment with a healthcare representative. These people are unaware of the majority of medical conditions presented to them. I propose that a person applying for PIP, should be awarded this based on a report produced by their medical team looking after them.

attributes.action: Set minimum prices for milk and other dairy products
attributes.background: Supermarkets force dairy farms to sell milk at below production costs or lose contracts. So dairy farms prioritise milk yield of cattle over animal welfare leading to cruelty(e.g zero grazing, unhealthy cattle selectively bred for milk yield only). Huge amounts of unsold milk is poured down drains.
attributes.additional_details:
Milk is still cheaper than bottled water, even after recent price rises due to some dairies being driven out of business by having to sell to supermarkets at a loss, reducing supply. That's crazy.
https://food.ndtv.com/opinions/dairy-farmers-call-for-supermarket-boycott-as-milk-price-falls-1204828
https://www.theguardian.com/business/2015/aug/06/dairy-farmers-call-for-supermarkets-boycott-as-milk-price-falls
https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/price-of-milk-to-go-up-after-dairy-closures-tr220h3sr

attributes.action: Make UK taxpayers' salary and tax searchable and revealable to other taxpayers
attributes.background: Making taxpayers' salary revealable to other taxpayers is achievable with our digital tax system. Openness about salary and tax paid can act to reduce the gap between boardroom and shop-floor pay, gender pay gap and tax evasion.
attributes.additional_details: Any taxpayers whose salary is searched for and revealed will be able to see the name and ref number of the taxpayer who their salary and tax totals have been revealed to. This reduces spurious usage and makes it equitable in that the searcher's salary can be searched for too. Inequality thrives in dark corners, make salary and taxation more open in the UK!

attributes.action: Electrocardiogram (ECG) scans should be made compulsory for all young people.
attributes.background: Test every teenager for deadly undiagnosed heart defects that kills 12 people every week in the UK. 80% of heart defects are found through ECG scans, as there are no symptoms - meaning hundreds of lives would be saved each year. One in 500 people suffer and their hearts could stop at any point.
attributes.additional_details: Renowned cardiologist Professor Sanjay Sharma, medical director for the virgin London Marathon and Professor of Cardiology at St George's University Hospital, agrees saying: 'Each week 12 young people in the UK die suddenly from a heart condition they didn't know they had.' 'The vast majority of those - more than 80% - won't have symptoms, but the same proportion would have been picked up through a three minute ECG.'

attributes.action: Put pressure on Bangladeshi government to improve road safety
attributes.background: In light of the recent events where two students were killed by a speeding driver,many students have been protesting for safer roads however they have been silenced by the police in the form of violence. Actions must be taken to ensure the safety of these people and to allow their voices to be heard

attributes.action: Create a single register of eligible voters managed by the Electoral Commission
attributes.background:
Currently local registration offices manage over 350 electoral rolls in the UK.

This petition calls for creation of a single register to be managed by the independent Electoral Commission.

Such a register would help promote public confidence in the democratic process and ensure its integrity.

attributes.action: Allow parents to claim carers allowance for more than one child who receive DLA
attributes.background: I am a mother of 2 disabled children. They both are in reciept of high rate DLA and mobility. Therefore I claim carers allowance of £64.60 a week which is way below the national minimum wage. One of my children has various complex medical neeeds and is a full on 24/7 365 days a week nursing role.
attributes.additional_details: As parents and full time carers to our children, most of us can not work due to the complex nature of our children’s medical needs. Therefore I am calling on our government to enable us full time parent carers of more than one disabled child to be able to claim the £64.60 per week for each of our children who are in receipt of DLA and not just one.

attributes.action: To legally stagger school holidays in each county in England
attributes.background: The current holiday system for schools forces holiday prices up very high in current school hols as all parents want holidays at similar times. Spreading this demand out by schools having different weeks off would lower prices for families but shouldn’t affect holiday companies profit. Help!!
attributes.additional_details: This is an ongoing issue known by everyone. I think rather than sitting back and letting families struggle for years to take their kids away something should be done. It’s not feasible to ask holiday companies to change prices without demand changing and the only way that can change is the government changing school holidays in England. Help families. Don’t just accept how it is!!

attributes.action: Bring Welfare Assessments back to the DWP and scrap contracts with providers
attributes.background: There are widespread reports of Capita producing PIP and ESA assessments that are inaccurate, contain factual errors and ignore important evidence. There are too many appeals being lost by the DWP because of Capita's incompetence.
attributes.additional_details: People are being made seriously ill as a result of the appalling record of Capita’s assessments. It seems Capita make headlines about errors and omissions in all their govt contracts but the most serious is their atrocious record in Welfare assessments.

attributes.action: Children who are registered for home education to have mandatory welfare checks.
attributes.background: When a child is removed from the school roll and registered for home education, there is a loss of the safeguarding layer of that child that teachers and schools currently provide. Parents have no legal obligation to let education department visit the home and determine if a suitable environment.
attributes.additional_details:
Children who are home schooled are at risk of becoming hidden children, with the opportunity to identify risks to their welfare in their home environment severely diminished. 
A simple welfare check on a monthly or quarterly basis would be key to preventing these scenarios.

attributes.action: Pass a law to prevent landlords refusing people to have pets.
attributes.background: We request you pass a law that forbids landlords to deny tenants a pet as it will prove beneficial for people and animals alike.
attributes.additional_details: Having pets has been proved to be very beneficial for health, lowering blood pressure, helping with stress etc. For people living alone they are companionship. For children, it educates them about caring and having compassion for other living creatures along with responsibility of such. With so many animal shelters full, the problem is being exhasperated by private landlords denying people a basic right to have a pet. For time immemorial people have kept animals as pets and surely it is within their human rights to do so.

attributes.action: No one can become an MP without having worked 15 years in the workplace.
attributes.background: 'Career' politicians do not have experience of our lives in the UK.  The 'workplace' is defined as any job that is not associated with politics.  EG salaried lobbyists and union representatives would not be able to become MPs unless they had also worked in other professions for 15 years.
attributes.additional_details: Too many current politicians take PPE at university, join lobby or other political organisations, then seek a parliamentary seat.  Ambition, rather than vocation, is their motivation; this is not in the national interest.  Parliament lacks expertise in industrial, engineering, and practical areas.  Academics are needed too, but most decisions require life experiences that the majority of MPs do not have.  We need you to work for us, not just further your ambitions, and play power games.

attributes.action: Legislate to ensure all future England football matches are 'free to air'
attributes.background:
The excitement, drama, joy & pain of being an England supporter has been made so evident to a new generation. 

We should encourage those fans to hold their interest in the wonderful game and allow TV licence paid access for all of them and us diehards too. 

No satellite/cable//other fee needed
attributes.additional_details:
Euro 2020 Final is at Wembley on 12th July 2020.

Let us be there all the way.

It's coming home!

This wiki about OfCom, the Broadcasting Act 1996 & subsequent Regulations shows only that only the finals for Euro 2020 are covered and that all other qualifying matches/friendlies will be pay per view or subscription. 

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ofcom_Code_on_Sports_and_Other_Listed_and_Designated_Events

attributes.action: Replace the compulsory subject of RE for basic level psychology and counselling.
attributes.background: We are in the middle of a mental health revolution. The world of psychology is making advances and stigmas are being broken down in society. Mental health effects everybody either directly or indirectly and it is our duty to make sure children are given the tools needed to deal with these issues.
attributes.additional_details: In our modern day of technology wasting precious educational time and taxpayers money to teach religion is outdated. Any teenager has access to the internet where they can learn about any religion to their hearts content. Instead with this time we can introduce teens to basic level psychology. To get children asking questions, growing their knowledge on issues and learning how to deal them. Many time it takes humans a while to learn about themselves so the more headstart we can give the better.

attributes.action: Establish Compulsory Mental Health & Wellbeing Workshops for Secondary Schools
attributes.background: To date, there has been a marked increase in youth related depression and suicide. Taboos against mental health confound public acceptance of mental health issues. This petition aims to address this, starting with the introduction of compulsory mental health workshops to secondary education.
attributes.additional_details:
Sources:

https://www.ons.gov.uk/peoplepopulationandcommunity/wellbeing/adhocs/006721childrensmentalillhealthbytimespentonsocialnetworkingsitesuk2013to2014

https://www.time-to-change.org.uk/blog/why-mental-illness-regarded-taboo-compared-physical-illness

https://www.theguardian.com/society/2009/feb/20/mental-health-taboo

https://www.independent.co.uk/news/education/education-news/millennials-uk-mental-health-depression-world-ranking-second-worst-study-anxiety-a7572026.html

attributes.action: Introduce retesting every ten years for drivers/driving license.
attributes.background: Every driver falls into bad habits or are not up to date with the current rules of the road, after driving for years. They put themselves, and others at risk. If we introduce that every driver must re-take their test every ten years, more drivers would be better informed of the rules of the road.
attributes.additional_details:
This would also create more jobs, eg more driving teachers/testers. Every ten years when it’s time to re-take your driving test, the first retake would be free, however, if you fail, you must pay the same cost as your first ever tests.

Also if your main job is driving eg delivery trucks, perhaps the re-take test time should be every 5 years.

All in all this would mean more money for the government, safer drivers with drivers being better informed thus making safer roads.

attributes.action: Government to take back FULL control of the Rail Network, end Privatisation!
attributes.background:
In recent years, the uk Rail Network has seen reckless actions in regards to weak bids that have fallen through, clauses that have cost millions of pounds and numerous bail outs & takeovers that where unnecessary, or preventable! 

We feel it’s time the the UK regains control of its train network
attributes.additional_details:
The state of the Bidding process is flawed, calling for multiple amendments and cost franchisees and the taxpayer millions of pounds.

It seems to be that operators are more interested in making money than seeing the needs of its key objectives that involve passengers and rail infrastructure!

The state of the past and present of the East Coast Mainline, Great Western Mainline, and many other areas of UK Franchises having final warnings or ‘Bail outs’.

It’s time the UK Rail became Public again!

attributes.action: All Diabetes sufferers should be entitled to free dental treatment
attributes.background: I was diagnosed with Type II Diabetes in 2016. I hadn't required any dental treatment for over 10 years but suddenly felt that my gums were receding. The dentist later told me that diabetic people are very prone to gum disease. Besides free eye tests and feet checks, dental care should be included.
attributes.additional_details:
People with diabetes are at greater risk for dental problems.

They're more likely to have infections of their gums and the bones that hold their teeth in place, because diabetes can reduce the blood supply to the gums.

High blood sugar may also cause dry mouth and make gum disease worse. Less saliva can allow more tooth-decaying bacteria and plaque buildup.

attributes.action: Government to urge all countries ban trophy hunting.
attributes.background: I believe the UK Government should put all the pressure it can to make Trophy Hunting illegal worldwide. If we do not do something magnificent creatures will be lost for future generations. I would also like to be illegal to kill a similar creature in Britain.
attributes.additional_details: Trophy hunters are killing 70,000 animals ever year.

attributes.action: Increase organ donation by asking GP's to discuss the issue with their patients.
attributes.background:
I would like to raise awareness for organ donation to help those currently awaiting a transplant. At present, GP's do not ask patients whether they have ever considered donating their organs. 
I would like GP's to ask patients about organ donation as part of their routine medical appointments.
attributes.additional_details:
Over 7000 people are currently on the organ donation register awaiting a chance to improve their health and well-being. I am trying to increase awareness of the importance of organ donation across the UK and break down the stigma of having this crucial conversation. 
GP's play a vital role within our communities and have a close professional relationship with their patients, where discussions may be held freely. Please support my campaign to increase awareness and enrolment for organ donation.

attributes.action: Ban Smacking In England
attributes.background: Smacking isn’t needed and many times it has been proven by specialists that smacking isn’t needed to correct bad behavior. It’s time to ban it and humanely educate our kids to behave without hitting them.

attributes.action: Provide statutory youth services and programs.
attributes.background: There is currently no statutory obligation on local authorities to provide Youth Service Programs in respective Councils across the UK. Recently, this has meant that councils, when faced with Government austerity cuts, have had to slash services to young people.
attributes.additional_details:
Due to these drastic measures, many Youth Centres in the hearts of our communities have already faced forced closure and hundreds of thousands of young people now face a much-reduced range of services, support, guidance and now lack access to opportunities to acquire critical life skills. 

According to research on the government website london.gov.uk, between 2011 and 2017, at least £39 million has been slashed from council youth service budgets across London. Across 25 councils with similar data, 81 youth centres and major council-supported projects have been cut, and about 800 youth service posts are gone. 

A statutory youth program would mean that the government would proper scrutinize where the money they invest in youth channelled programs would be spent well.

attributes.action: Offer more funding to suicide and self-harm charities.
attributes.background: The rates of suicide and self-harm cases are extremely alarming in present day. Whilst there are charitable organisations trying to combat these issues, there is more than can be done. With the digital age that we currently live in, more can be done to ensure that these charities are being utilised.
attributes.additional_details: Potentially, phone companies being required to install these numbers in people's phone books, mandatory app's with the information. The help is there, but people need to know it's there.

attributes.action: Ban Smoking on streets
attributes.background: Smoking on the streets is bad for other people through passive smoking and the environment.
attributes.additional_details: It was proven that when the indoor smoking ban was brought into force over 700,000 people stopped smoking

attributes.action: Public enquiry into new 2018 train timetables' severe delays and cancellations
attributes.background: Since the introduction of new train timetables in May 2018, services by multiple train opertators have been serverely affected daily delays and cancellations. Poor forward planning by operators has caused unacceptable inconvenience, loss of earnings and damage to regional and national economies.

attributes.action: Allow the NHS to accept financial donations at a national level
attributes.background: There's one thing everyone agrees on in the UK, everyone values the NHS. The incredible impact from NHS staff is felt by family and friends near and far. Yet while the Government discusses blanket tax rises, they fail to recognise the easiest route to raising cash, through voluntary donations.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently, it is possible to donate to small pockets of the NHS, mainly NHS Trusts, however, this doesn't go far enough and it's pretty hard to access. 

In 2017, the RNLI raised £196m (this figure grows year on year) through fundraising, imagine if the NHS created a central pot to accept donations.

attributes.action: Change the law so that all food sold in stores has allergy labels
attributes.background: Food such as bakery items made in store that are left on the shelf for consumers to buy do not have to have allergen information. The stores cover themselves by having a small sign on shelf to imply the risk of contamination or ingredients, but the item itself doesn’t contain any such information.
attributes.additional_details: A family member purchased a bakery item and gave it to my child. One hour after eating, my son passed out from an allergic reaction. Had the label clearly showed the ingredients, this could have been avoided. This could have been so much worse had it been another child/person. I want allergy info on all food items.

attributes.action: Refund 50% of 2018 car tax to offset the cost to Motorists and Motorbike Riders
attributes.background:
Due to the Extreme weather conditions 
The UK Roads are at their worst condition for years and are filled with potholes and loose chipping that are causing untold damage to suspension and tyres. This heavy cost of repair is a burden. Councils have not carried out repairs so a refund should assist
